ratings.comment: Although the lectures were a bit dry and he tended to jump all over the place the material was fairly interesting. It's by far one of the better classes to take for your C or D column requirement if you're a bio major. The test averages are low but there's a generous curve and he's very helpful one on one during his office hours.
If I could rate him worse I would.  Disgusting tests and quizzes.  Pretty sure I learned nothing. Don't recommend taking unless they get a new professor, or a monkey to teach the class.

Absolutely the worse course I have ever taken. DO NOT take this class unless required. Utterly useless when it comes to teaching, considering the unadjusted exam scores were all in the D range. It's as if he's trying to trick the class by being confusing.

Changes nomenclature in the middle of the class, it started at rate of fixation, then rate of substitution, then for the exam it changed to rate of turnover.  Quiz and exam questions are convoluted.  Lecture is unhelpful, take some other class, ecology of fishes (its a football player class)
terrible, book is the only thing that saved me. just word vomits during lecture. no connections between points, just important things here and there, structure needed. bad question writing

If you're in this class, you're most likely a science major, yet he teaches the class as if it were filled with journalism and fashion design majors.  His lectures are mind-numbing, considering he takes the WHOLE class to discuss one concept that can be summed up in a paragraph.

Professor Peters was ok when it comes to profs on campus. I agree that the mathematical portion of his class was made far more difficult than it had to be, count yourself lucky if you've take Genetics before this and use those notes for this section. He is not entirely clear during lectures, but the material is good for those who have an interest.

The WORST class I've taken in college. An easy A for sure, but at what price. I'm stunned by how little material he covered; yet he actually made 8th grade math seem difficult. Moved way, way, way too slow. I didn't want to go to class, but the slides weren't comprehensive so I went and sat through 50 minutes of pain for about 5 min of information.

this guy is waaay too excited about the subject, which makes him jump all over the place...hard to follow.  too much use of chalkboard.  quizzes hard, exams easy.  no need for the book.  talks to the class as if they're stupid, which is very annoying, but yet still doesn't seem to get his points across.

Ok, I don't know what everyone else is talking about. I thought Andy was great. Clear lectures if you're paying attention. Helpful in answering questions. The weekly quizzes come DIRECTLY from the study questions. He does write a lot on the board that doesn't show up in the power-points so don't skip lecture unless you have to. Don't buy the book.

Andy Peters teaches this course about as well as France defends its home turf.  Never before have fractions and multiplication made to be so difficult.  The irony surrounding this class is, if evolution was acting in a natural sense for the human population, our class would have selected a new professor a long, long time ago.

If you have ever had a really good teacher, one that had a talent for communicating concepts...Peters is the exact opposite. Or at least somewhere between that and complete ineptitude. If you have taken an intro bio class and/or own a calculator you can probably teach this better than he can. Give it a try, I'm sure there's good money in it.

I love biology.  I expected to love this class.  I did not.  And I blame it on the professor.  He was BORING and has a terrible teaching style.  Power points don't contain everything he writes on the board.  Quizzes unnecessarily tricky, exams too.  I got an A but hated it.  DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK- huge waste of money for something I never used.

Taught in a very clear fashion but material is sometimes difficult to grasp.  Very patient and is willing to answer questions in class.  There are online quizzes every week but the questions are word for word from his study questions.
not too bad
Ack.

Very tough.  Some exam problems are good, to the point, you know it or not.  Others are just simply put...tricky.  Material seems to be easier to understand as the class goes on, but exams seem to get tougher.  Was very interested in the material itself, did not like the class.
No Comments
